comments.body: that is not the same. `type Mark = {}` would be.

I tried this but `type Mark = {}` leads to
```ERROR: 3178:22  interface-over-type-literal  Use an interface instead of a type literal.```
And keeping the previous `interface Mark {}` throws
```ERROR: 3178:27  no-empty-interface  An empty interface is equivalent to `{}`.```
So how to solve it properly?

Yes, see the examples and parameters for `static createIcon()` here: https://developer.here.com/visualization/documentation/datalens/h-datalens-objectlayer.html
Where `options.size: { H.math.ISize | number } [optional]`
Do we need to keep this indexer? Originally, I put this in as this was all the detail provided by the HERE docs, and I hadn't thought to look at the structure of the result myself! :P
I left it as a fallback just in case I there is another result structure.

`DefaultLayers` seems like a `H.service.Platform.MapTypes` that makes a number of members non-optional, but it is missing the indexer provided by `H.service.Platform.MapTypes`. This could break existing consumers of this method.

One option would be to return `H.service.Platform.MapTypes & H.service.DefaultLayers` here instead.

I disagree with this one - the return type from the API has changed since I wrote that definition. If you look at the docs: https://developer.here.com/javascript-apis/documentation/v3/maps/topics_api/h-service-platform.html#h-service-platform__createdefaultlayers, the return type is quite well defined now.

The API docs used to say that that method returned `{Object<string, H.service.Platform.MapType>}`. The `normal`, `satellite` and `terrain` map types were the only map types I found returned, but I couldn't guarantee that they were the *only* map types. Hence the indexer in the interface.
Thanks for the clarification, @Josh-ES. @denyo, I concur with this. Your initial change of the return type to `H.service.DefaultLayers` seems to be the better choice here.
